components

Class BinomialHeap

  • java.lang.Object
    • components.BinomialHeap
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Heap

    public class BinomialHeap
extends java.lang.Object
implements Heap
    Provides the basic implementation of a binomial maximum heap. It contains the typical methods expected from a maximum heap - insertion, returning the maximum value, deleting maximum and increasing key.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BinomialHeap()
      Constructor for the binomial heap.

      Increases the value of the key in the given node.

      Inserts a new value into the heap.

      BinomialHeap union(BinomialHeap secondHeap)

    • Constructor Detail

      • BinomialHeap

        public BinomialHeap()
        Constructor for the binomial heap. At the start, the head is set to null.

    • Method Detail

      • makeBinomialHeap

        public BinomialHeap makeBinomialHeap()
        Creates and returns a new binomial heap with head set to null.
        Returns:
        a new binomial heap.

      • getHead

        public BinomialNode getHead()
        Returns the head node of the current binomial heap.
        Returns:
        the head node.

      • returnMax

        public int returnMax()
        Returns the maximum value of the heap.
        Specified by:
        returnMax in interface Heap
        Returns:
        the maximum value found after iterating through the current head and its siblings i.e. the root list of the heap.

      • deleteMax

        public int deleteMax()
        Finds the maximum value of the heap, deletes it and then returns it. Before returning the maximum value, the method also reorganises the heap should it prove necessary.
        Specified by:
        deleteMax in interface Heap
        Returns:
        the maximum value that was deleted.

      • insert

        public void insert(int newValue)
        Inserts a new value into the heap. Insertion requires the heap to be rebuilt with the union method.
        Specified by:
        insert in interface Heap
        Parameters:
        newValue - the value to be inserted into the heap.

      • increaseKey

        public void increaseKey(BinomialNode nodeToIncrease,
                        int newKey)
        Increases the value of the key in the given node.
        Parameters:
        nodeToIncrease - the node containing the key to be increased.
        newKey - the new value of the key.

      • union

        public BinomialHeap union(BinomialHeap secondHeap)
        Unites two binomial heaps into one while making sure that the resulting heap abides by the binomial heap properties.
        Parameters:
        secondHeap - the heap to be united with the current heap.
        Returns:
        the heap that resulted from uniting the current heap with the given heap.

      • link

        public void link(BinomialNode firstNode,
                 BinomialNode secondNode)
        Helper method for the union operation. Its purpose is to make the given first node the new head of the second node's child nodes.
        Parameters:
        firstNode - the first node to be linked.
        secondNode - the second node to be linked.

      • merge

        public BinomialNode merge(BinomialHeap firstHeap,
                          BinomialHeap secondHeap)
        Helper method for the union operation. Its purpose is to merge the root lists of the given heaps into a single linked list which is sorted by degree into increasing order.
        Parameters:
        firstHeap - the first heap to be merged.
        secondHeap - the second heap to be merged.
        Returns:
        the merged heap.
